content.question: The function f is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F46@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for −5 ≤ x ≤ 5. (a) Find f'(x).

frqParts.text: The function f is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F46@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for −5 ≤ x ≤ 5. (a) Find f'(x).
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at x = -3.

(c) Let g be the function defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext>   for </mtext> <mo>-</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>7</mn> <mtext>  for </mtext> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5.</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4zaiaacI cacaWG4bGaaiykaiabg2da9maaceaaeaqabeaacaWGMbGaaiikaiaa dIhacaGGPaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaaeOzaiaab+gacaqGYbGaae iiaiaac2cacaaI1aGaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJkaac2cacaaIZaaa baGaamiEaiabgUcaRiaaiEdacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabAgacaqGVbGaae OCaiaabccacaGGTaGaaG4maiabgYda8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaI1aGa aiOlaaaacaGL7baaaaa@592F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> Is g continuous at x = -3? Use the definition of continuity to explain your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
